column2: GEORGIA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Georgia

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Slow down, slippery when wet

column2: 2. When you approach this sign, you must:
column4: watch for workers crossing the road.

column2: 3. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.
column8: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.

column2: 4. Which signs have black letters on a yellow or orange background?
column4: Regulatory signs (vertical rectangle)

column2: 5. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 6. The first sign drivers see when approaching a highway-rail intersection is usually:
column4: an advance warning sign.

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Lane shifting

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Drivers are about to enter a one way street the wrong way
column8: Drivers may proceed if the way is clear

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Intersection ahead

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: The road will curve to the right.
column6: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 11. This sign means:
column4: Detour to the right
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 12. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Warning signs

column2: 13. A flashing yellow light:
column4: is used at dangerous intersections.
column6: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 14. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: exclusively for stop signs.
column6: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: the right lane ends.
column8: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 16. This road sign tells drivers that:
column4: the one-way street or roadway ahead ends.
column6: they must turn either to the right or left.

column2: 17. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column6: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 18. This sign warns that:
column4: traffic must merge left.
column8: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.

column2: 19. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
column4: green; white

column2: 20. A flashing red light:
column4: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 21. Driver distractions include:
column4: turning your headlights on when rain and fog make it hard to see.
column6: Slowing down to look at crash scene.

column2: 22. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column4: riding the pedal lightly.
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 23. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: signal other vehicles to stop.
column6: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 24. You are driving in the far right lane of a four lane freeway and notice broken white lines on the left side of your lane. You are driving:
column4: in an exit lane.
column8: in a special lane for slow moving vehicles.

column2: 25. Drivers may cross a double yellow line to pass another vehicle if:
column4: the vehicle ahead moves to the right to let them pass.
column6: the yellow line next to their side of the road is broken.
column8: the yellow line next to the other side of the road is broken.

column2: 26. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column4: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column6: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 27. If a traffic officer signals you to drive through a red light:
column4: you must wait for the red light to turn green.
column8: you must not obey the officer. Signs and signals take precedence over directions given by traffic officers.

column2: 28. There are two traffic lanes in your direction. You are driving in the left lane and many vehicles are passing you on the right, and the driver behind you wishes to drive faster. You should:
column4: move over into the right lane when safe to do so.
column6: drive onto the left shoulder to let the other driver pass.
column8: stay in your lane and maintain your current speed.

column2: 29. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 30. If you continually pass the other vehicles on a road with one lane in each direction, you will:
column4: help prevent the chances of a crash occurring due to traffic congestion.
column6: get to your destination much faster.
column8: increase your chances of being involved in an accident.

column2: 31. Drivers should check their rearview mirrors:
column4: to see if a truck is in their blind spot.
column8: often to see how traffic is moving behind them.

column2: 32. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: Yes.
column6: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column8: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.

column2: 33. Speed limit signs are:
column4: service signs

column2: 34. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.
column6: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column8: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.

column2: 35. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: The use of headlight is required by law.

column2: 36. A yellow arrow means:
column4: If you intend to turn in the direction of the arrow, be prepared to stop.
column6: The same as a steady yellow light.
column8: Do not go in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 37. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column8: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.

column2: 38. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column4: tailgating.

column2: 39. You have allowed the wheels of your vehicle to run off the edge of the pavement. You should:
column4: apply the brakes firmly and turn the front wheels sharply to the right.
column6: hold the steering wheel tightly, slowly take your foot off the gas pedal and gently apply the brakes. Wait  until  your  speed  has reduced, check  the traffic and look for a place to safely re-turn to the roadway.
column8: hold the steering wheel tightly and shift into neutral to bring the front of the vehicle back in line.

column2: 40. If you drive slower than the flow of traffic, you will most likely:
column4: interfere with traffic and receive a ticket.
column8: help create a safe driving environment.
